Sentencas: Hydrogen production via water electrolysis using solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs) has attracted considerable attention because of its favorable thermodynamics and kinetics.
Titulo: 3D Self-Architectured Steam Electrode Enabled Efficient and Durable Hydrogen Production in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cell at Temperatures Lower Than 600 °C

Sentencas: It is considered as the most efficient and low-cost option for hydrogen production from renewable energies.
Titulo: 3D Self-Architectured Steam Electrode Enabled Efficient and Durable Hydrogen Production in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cell at Temperatures Lower Than 600 °C

Sentencas: By using proton-conducting electrolyte (H-SOECs), the operating temperature can be reduced from beyond 800 to 600 degrees C or even lower due to its higher conductivity and lower activation energy.
Titulo: 3D Self-Architectured Steam Electrode Enabled Efficient and Durable Hydrogen Production in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cell at Temperatures Lower Than 600 °C

Sentencas: Technical barriers associated with the conventional oxygen-ion conducting SOECs (O-SOECs), that is, hydrogen separation and electrode instability that is primarily due to the Ni oxidation at high steam concentration and delamination associated with oxygen evolution, can be remarkably mitigated.
Titulo: 3D Self-Architectured Steam Electrode Enabled Efficient and Durable Hydrogen Production in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cell at Temperatures Lower Than 600 °C

Sentencas: Here, a self-architectured ultraporous (SAUP) 3D steam electrode is developed for efficient H-SOECs below 600 degrees C.
Titulo: 3D Self-Architectured Steam Electrode Enabled Efficient and Durable Hydrogen Production in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cell at Temperatures Lower Than 600 °C

Sentencas: At 600 degrees C, the electrolysis current density reaches 2.02 A cm(-2) at 1.6 V. Instead of fast degradation in most O-SOECs, performance enhancement is observed during electrolysis at an applied voltage of 1.6 V at 500 degrees C for over 75 h, attributed to the bridging effect originating from reorganization of the steam electrode.
Titulo: 3D Self-Architectured Steam Electrode Enabled Efficient and Durable Hydrogen Production in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cell at Temperatures Lower Than 600 °C

Sentencas: The H-SOEC with SAUP steam electrode demonstrates excellent performance, promising a new prospective for next-generation steam electrolysis at reduced temperatures.
Titulo: 3D Self-Architectured Steam Electrode Enabled Efficient and Durable Hydrogen Production in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cell at Temperatures Lower Than 600 °C
